newsitem.title: USA: U.S. July budget deficit $27.1 bln.
newsitem.headline: U.S. July budget deficit $27.1 bln.

text.p: The government posted a budget deficit of $27.1 billion in July, the Treasury Department said Wednesday, twice the $13.6 billion deficit posted a year earlier in July 1995.
By contrast in June this year, the budget was in surplus by $34.1 billion.
Total outlays in July were $130.9 billion, up from $117.8 billion in June and up from $106.3 billion in July 1995.
Receipts fell to $103.8 billion from $151.9 billion in June but were up from $92.7 billion in July 1995.
During the first 10 months of fiscal 1996 that ends on September 30, the budget deficit was $102.1 billion, down from $137.2 billion in the comparable first 10 months of fiscal 1995.
The Clinton administration has forecast that the deficit for the full 1996 fiscal year will fall to $117 billion from $163.9 billion for all of fiscal 1995.
